description: Unified APT Intelligence Database - Merged from apt-profiles.json and apt-database.js with enhanced AttackIQ scenario mappings

groups.name: APT28
groups.description: Russian state-sponsored APT group active since at least 2007. Known for targeting government, military, and security organizations worldwide. Associated with Russian military intelligence (GRU).

references.title: APT28: A Window into Russia's Cyber Espionage Operations

groups.name: APT29
groups.description: Russian state-sponsored APT group active since at least 2008. Associated with Russian Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR). Known for sophisticated and stealthy operations.

campaigns.name: SolarWinds Supply Chain Attack
campaigns.description: Massive supply chain compromise affecting thousands of organizations

references.title: Highly Evasive Attacker Leverages SolarWinds Supply Chain

groups.name: Lazarus Group
groups.description: North Korean state-sponsored APT group active since at least 2009. Known for both espionage and financially motivated attacks. Responsible for major cyber attacks including Sony Pictures and WannaCry.

campaigns.name: Sony Pictures Hack
campaigns.description: Destructive attack on Sony Pictures Entertainment

campaigns.name: SWIFT Banking Heists
campaigns.description: Theft of millions from banks via SWIFT network

references.title: HIDDEN COBRA - North Korean Malicious Cyber Activity

groups.name: APT41
groups.description: Chinese state-sponsored APT group active since at least 2012. Unique for conducting both state-sponsored espionage and financially motivated operations. Targets healthcare, telecom, and technology sectors.

references.title: APT41: A Dual Espionage and Cyber Crime Operation

groups.name: APT1
groups.description: Chinese state-sponsored APT group active since at least 2006. One of the first publicly exposed APT groups. Associated with PLA Unit 61398. Known for large-scale intellectual property theft.

references.title: APT1: Exposing One of China's Cyber Espionage Units

groups.name: APT10
groups.description: Chinese state-sponsored APT group active since at least 2009. Known for targeting managed service providers (MSPs) to gain access to their clients. Associated with Chinese Ministry of State Security (MSS).

campaigns.name: Cloud Hopper
campaigns.description: Massive campaign targeting MSPs to access their clients

references.title: APT10 (MenuPass Group): New Tools, Global Campaign Latest Manifestation of Longstanding Threat

groups.name: APT33
groups.description: Iranian state-sponsored APT group active since at least 2013. Known for targeting aviation and energy sectors. Associated with Iranian government.

references.title: Insights into Iranian Cyber Espionage: APT33 Targets Aerospace and Energy Sectors

groups.name: FIN7
groups.description: Financially motivated cybercrime group active since at least 2013. Known for targeting banks, retail, hospitality, and financial institutions. Responsible for stealing over $1 billion from banks worldwide. Linked to DarkSide and BlackMatter ransomware operations.
